content: Tamil is the most widely spoken Dravidian language, with around 80 million speakers worldwide. In India, it is the official language of the state of Tamil Nadu and is also spoken in parts of other states like Karnataka, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh. Tamil is one of the 22 official languages of India and has official status in Sri Lanka and Singapore as well. The other major Dravidian languages are Telugu, Kannada, and Malayalam, each with around 50-60 million speakers. While Tamil is the most spoken and widely recognized of the Dravidian languages, all of them have their own unique characteristics and rich literary traditions.
